q: Tuesday, Democratic Sen. Joe Lieberman Kent Conrad , 62, who's led efforts to get the John McCain budget under control, said on Tuesday that he will not run for a sixth term in the Senate in 2012. It is more important Sen. Joe Lieberman spend my time and energy trying to solve these( budget) problems than to be distracted by a campaign for re-election, Kent Conrad said in a statement. Democrats now control the Senate 53-47. There are 51 Democrats and two independents-- Sen. Joe Lieberman and Sen. Bernie Sanders of Vermont, both of whom caucus with Democrats. Republicans are

There's going to be that transition that might have a few hiccups to it, he said. New York Barack Obama Kirsten Gillibrand 's request. The two women and House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi were in Gabrielle Giffords ' hospital room holding her hand when her eye fluttered open. Kirsten Gillibrand told reporters the congresswomen were telling Gabrielle Giffords how proud we were of her and how she was inspiring the whole nation with her courage and with her strength. And then Debbie Wasserman Schultz and I started joking about all the things we were going to do after she got better. Gabrielle Giffords was gripping their hands, "and the more we joked about what we were going to do, she started to open her eyes." Andy Coulson one degree of separation to the McCann affair: McCann family spokesman Clarence Mitchell joins CCHQ as head of media monitoring for the election www.prweek.com PR Week has the story: The Conservative Party has signed up Clarence Mitchell , best-known as spokesman for Madeleine McCann's parents, as the head of media monitoring for its general election campaign, PRWeek can exclusively reveal. " Clarence Mitchell joins the Tory comms operation today, reporting directly to director of communications Andy Coulson . Clarence Mitchell , who was the director of the Government's media monitoring unit for two years( 2005-2007) will take a back room role, monitoring the progress of the Tories' campaign in the media.
